business

Class Employee

  • java.lang.Object
    • business.Person
      • business.Employee
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    business.Testable, java.io.Serializable

    public class Employee
extends business.Person
implements java.io.Serializable, business.Testable
    Class Employee represents a real-world Employee. Could have methods to calculate pay to be used for a Payroll application.

    Run instructions: 

     java applications.Assignment3 [< ../data/Employee.txt]
    1. private String employeeId;
    2. private String jobTitle;
    3. private String salary; // either the hourly rate for wage workers or the annual salary for salaried workers
    4. private String payType; // payment type - by the hour or salary
    5. private double grossThisPay; // gross pay this payment period
    6. private double taxThisPay; // tax deduction for this payment period
    7. private double pensionThisPay; // pension deduction for this payment period
    8. private double unionThisPay; // union fee deduction for this payment period
    9. private double netThisPay; // net pay for this payment period
    10. private double grossYTD; // gross for year-to-date
    11. private double taxYTD;
    12. private double pensionYTD;
    13. private double unionYTD;
    14. private double netYTD;
    15. private static String[] prompts // the prompts that are displayed for the user to enter data

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Igor Entaltsev
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calculatePension()
      This method: Calculates the pension for the current period as 6% of the grossPayThisPeriod. Subtract the calculated amount from both the taxThisPay and taxYTD instance variables.
      void calculateSalary()
      This method will only be called for objects for salaried employees with payType “S4”).
      void calculateTax()
      This method: Calculates the tax for the current period as 10% of the grossPayThisPeriod. Subtracts the calculated amount from both the taxThisPay and taxYTD instance variables.
      void calculateUnion()
      This method: Calculate the union dues for current pay period as a fixed rate $2,00. Subtract the calculated amount from both the netThisPay and netYTD instance variables[.]

      This method will only be called for objects for hourly paid employees with payType “HW”) Calculates the gross pay for the current pay period for hourly rate employees (payType “HW” ) by multiplying the value of the salary variable by the value of hoursWorked (parameter 1). Adds the calculated amount to both the grossThisPay and grossYTD instance variables.

      • Employee

        public Employee()

    • Method Detail

      • calculatePension

        public void calculatePension()
        This method:
        1. Calculates the pension for the current period as 6% of the grossPayThisPeriod.
        2. Subtract the calculated amount from both the taxThisPay and taxYTD instance variables.

      • calculateSalary

        public void calculateSalary()
        This method will only be called for objects for salaried employees with payType “S4”).
        1. It calculates the gross pay for the current pay period by [?] for salaried employees (payType = “S4”) by dividing the value of the salary variable by thirteen.
        2. Adds the calculated amount to both the grossThisPay and grossYTD instance variables.

      • calculateTax

        public void calculateTax()
        This method:
        1. Calculates the tax for the current period as 10% of the grossPayThisPeriod.
        2. Subtracts the calculated amount from both the taxThisPay and taxYTD instance variables.

      • calculateUnion

        public void calculateUnion()
        This method:
        1. Calculate the union dues for current pay period as a fixed rate $2,00.
        2. Subtract the calculated amount from both the netThisPay and netYTD instance variables[.]

      • calculateWages

        public java.lang.String calculateWages(double hoursWorked)
        This method will only be called for objects for hourly paid employees with payType “HW”)
        1. Calculates the gross pay for the current pay period for hourly rate employees (payType “HW” ) by multiplying the value of the salary variable by the value of hoursWorked (parameter 1).
        2. Adds the calculated amount to both the grossThisPay and grossYTD instance variables.
        Parameters:
        hoursWorked - the amount of hours the employee has worked in 4 weeks

      • formatDisplay

        public int formatDisplay(java.lang.StringBuffer temp)
        In Order to test a class properly it is essential to be able to display the status of objects (ALL the data within the object).

        Formats the contents of the object into a String so that when displayed (by the application) it will make a "pretty" display.

        Specified by:
        formatDisplay in interface business.Testable
        Overrides:
        formatDisplay in class business.Person

        public int update(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
        inserts data from the StringBuffer, (param #1) into an empty object. The format of the StringBuffer is that provided by getData(...) in CSV format ... separator is first character of StringBuffer.
